cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi (90 km) southeast of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest and expected to track across the east-central Gulf of Mexico, aiming for the north-central Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from Ochlockonee River FL westward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line FL (Florida Panhandle)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana through the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible by late Tuesday or Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–5 ft above normal tides possible along southeast Louisiana coast including lower Mississippi River delta
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with locally up to 6 inches could fall across southeast Louisiana, producing flash-flood potential around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and minor coastal flooding; isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out as outer rain bands move inland
